climbs.name: Spanish Bayonet
climbs.fa: Lynn Hill, Roy McClenahan, Larry Stone & Jeff Sewell, April 1979

content.description:
Crux moves past a bolt lead into the crack proper which eats up gear, particularly hexes. Gear belay and walk off or rap from anchors atop

Carmania

.

A hidden gem of the Indian Cove area that's worth the somewhat arduous approach. Three stars out of five.

Up and left of Ancient Kingdom, on the hillside across from the Short Wall, is a large formation. Left of Center is a pillar/spire. this climb ascends the face of this pillar via lie-backs up a wide flake system. 3 bolts protect the liebacking crux. 2 pitches. Rappel from slings on the left side of the pillar below the top.
content.protection: A trad rack and QDs for the bolts.
content.location: On the hillside on a large un-named formation left of Ancient Kingdon.

content.description: this SE facing route starts on a shelf and traverses right on a thin rail before straightening out up a steep bucketed face.
content.location: hike up the canyon. Located on a wall across from Spanish Bayonet.

climbs.name: Carmania
climbs.fa: Jeff Sewell, Larry Stone, Roy McClenahan & Lynn Hill, April 1979

content.description:
This route ascends the obvious dihedral right of

Spanish Bayonet

. Technical moves in a left facing book down low lead to an overhanging dihedral at the top with large holds on both sides.
content.protection: An assortment of cams to 3.5" and stoppers are suitable for protection. Medium to large cams are required for the anchor. Rappel from fixed anchors with slings.

content.description: The meandering right-facing tiered dihedral to the right of Carmania.  Start up a shallow V-slot, then transit up and leftward to the higher corner, to lead to some unorthodox climbing at the finish.  Worth doing after finishing its more quality neighbors. To descend, walk across the stop to climber's left, past Carmania topout, and to the bolted rap anchor near Spanish Bayonet finish.
content.protection: Pro to 3", gear anchor. Descend using topside communal bolted rap anchor.
content.location: Right of Carmania and left of the prominent offwidth splitter start of El Cap (5.9).
